title: Seated Tahitian Women (related to the painting Nafea faa ipoipo [When Will You Marry?]) and Other Sketches

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of black fabricated chalk and pen and brown ink (originally purple), with traces of graphite on cream wove paper (removed from a sketchbook).

medium_display: Black fabricated chalk and pen and brown ink (originally purple), with traces of graphite on cream wove paper (removed from a sketchbook)
publication_history:
G. M. Sugana, Gauguin (Rizzoli, 1972), p. 103, under cat. 276.

Richard R. Brettell, Françoise Cachin, Claire Frèches-Thory, and Charles F. Stuckey, The Art of Paul Gauguin, with assistance from Peter Zegers, exh. cat. (National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C./Art Institute of Chicago/New York Graphic Society Books, 1988), p. 279, under cat. 153 (ill.).

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, exh. cat. (Auckland City Art Gallery/Art Institute of Chicago, 1995), pp. 38, 50, cat. 12 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 6.
exhibition_history:
Auckland, New Zealand, Auckland City Art Gallery, "Paul Gauguin: Pages From the Pacific," August 4-October 15, 1995, pp. 38 and 50, cat. 12 (ill.), cat. by Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific, The Edward McCormick Blair Collection," September 6, 2003-January 11, 2004, checklist 6.
provenance_text: Achille Weber, Paris by 1920 [acc. to Adam invoice]. From the nephew of Achille Weber [acc. to Adam invoice]. Sold to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, as the agent for Edward McCormick Blair (1915-2010), Chicago, March 13, 1985 [acc. to Adam invoice]. Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute, 2002.
section_titles: Cat. 32 Seated Tahitian Women and Other Sketches (recto), Sketches of Figures, Hands, and Feet (verso), 1891/93

input: Seated Tahitian Women (related to the painting Nafea faa ipoipo [When Will You Marry?]) and Other Sketches
